lead_paragraph: GLICKENHAUS--Seth, died peacefully at home at 102 years. Born in the Bronx, he graduated from Fieldston, Harvard College and NYU Law School. Born with a gift for numbers and economics, he had the unique distinction of longevity and worked in Wall Street during the 1929 Stock Market Crash, as well as during the 2008 Economic Crash. He continued working until the day he died. A strong social conscience, a commitment to helping others through action and philanthropy and a profound devotion to family and friends defined his life. Seth served in the Army's 10th Mountain Division Ski Troop in an effort to fight the Nazis. He had donated to over 1,000 charities and had served on the Boards of the Museum of Arts and Design, the Harvard School of Public Health, Mount Sinai Hospital, Renaissance and the Ethical Culture Fieldston School. He had also been a member of the New Rochelle Board of Education and fought to racially integrate the schools. A lifelong Democrat, Seth was proud to be listed on Nixon's Enemy List. Throughout his life, he had contributed to global peace efforts. Humanitarian causes and a commitment to help others gave his life inspiration. He is survived by his wife of 71 years, Sarah (Brody), his daughter Nancy, son James (Meg) and by his grandchildren Jesse (Amanda), Emily, Katherine (Greg) and Veronica (Gene) and by four great-grandchildren. Funeral private. Celebration of Life to be planned. 1/3
